headline.main: Bank of America Equalizes Health Costs for Gay Employees

docs.abstract: Bank of America will begin reimbursing employees with same-sex partners for the extra taxes they pay on domestic partner health insurance.
docs.snippet: Bank of America will begin reimbursing employees with same-sex partners for the extra taxes they pay on domestic partner health insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bank of America's new monthly debit card fee has been roundly criticized in recent weeks. But a new change in corporate policy change is likely to receive a much warmer reception.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a striking new video, Rick Perry attacks Mitt Romney as both the inspiration for President Obama's health care reform and a repeated flip-flopper who shouldn't be considered for the White House.

headline.main: 2,000 Stage Sit In on a London Bridge to Protest Health Care Cuts

docs.abstract: More than 2,000 people protesting potential cuts to the national health care system staged a sit-in on Westminster Bridge in London.
docs.snippet: More than 2,000 people protesting potential cuts to the national health care system staged a sit-in on Westminster Bridge in London.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 2,000 people protesting potential cuts to the national health care system staged a sit-in on Westminster Bridge in London on Sunday afternoon, blocking traffic on one of the city's busiest bridges, The Guardian reports.

docs.lead_paragraph: Even when unemployment was very high during the Depression, we were making great technological progress. Now, we suffer from stagnation in business and education.

headline.seo: The Depression: If Only Things Were That Good
headline.main: The Depression: If Only Things Were That Good
headline.print_headline: The Depression: If Only Things Were That Good

docs.abstract: David Leonhardt news analysis compares the Great Depression and America's current economic slump; asserts that the combination of short-term problems created by the financial crisis and the long-term problems that already existed in the economy raises the possibility that America has entered a phase in which high unemployment is the norm.
docs.snippet: Even when unemployment was very high during the Depression, we were making great technological progress. Now, we suffer from stagnation in business and education.
